ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed speaking, writing, and reading skills in Italian. L3 is mostly reviewing concepts already learned in L1 and L2, putting these skills into more conversations and readings. I became significantly more comfortable in my spoken and written Italian ability over the course of the class.
The course definitely solidified my skills in Italian. I feel much more confident in my speaking and writing abilities after this semester.
I expanded my italian vocabulary and refined my grammatical, speaking, reading, and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Relaxed, welcoming environment for speaking Italian, and Professor Pellegrino is an excellent, kind, and extremely engaging instructor
Weaknesses: Some members of the class are less engaged than others; nothing Deborah can do about this, but it definitely hurt the course.

I think that a strength of this course was the asynchronous workday on Friday. I think that this allowed for more immersive and fun assignments that could not be completed in class or as a daily homework assignment (such as movies or discussion board posts) and it was nice to be able to complete them at a time that was comfortable for me.

This course was well-structured to improve my knowledge of Italian! I really loved the diversity of materials we encountered, such as movies, music, longer written texts, and also the asynchronous days. I felt highly engaged with the content, especially Deborah created such a welcoming classroom environment!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student. If you are taking L3 Italian, I highly recommend you take it with Deborah specifically. With her instruction, I felt my ability to speak Italian advanced over the course of the semester.
Yes! This course is challenging, but it provides so many opportunities to improve your Italian speaking and comprehension while connecting with classmates and learning about Italian culture.
Yes, L3 with Deborah is a great!
Yes! I would highly recommend taking Italian at any level--this class was lovely and whole department is so kind!
